reviews.review_msg: Show up to lectures and tutorials!! He gives lots of helpful tips and even hints on what he expects from assignments and essays. His grading is tough but fair, and if you listen to feedback it really helps you do better on later assignments. Lectures are fun, engaging, and I really liked the readings he assigned. He is a very knowledgeable prof.
Just kind of boring and basic, maybe was just class content.

For a non-hum student, the course content was very intriguing. Lots of papers and readings but learned a lot. Deadlines were extended for literally every paper and class was held every other week so it was hard to keep up with the course flow. You would lose attendance marks if you skip even a single class.

If you have a genuine interest in the course topics, classes with him will be amazing. Class was at Surrey so we had no TA; he ran tutorials. Sounds like Brian from Family Guy. He`s very witty and insightful. His feedback on your papers is extremely helpful. I feel like my writing improved by  a ton just from having him as a prof. He`s brilliant.
Great fun, fair marker, incredible resource, and the nicest guy. Cannot say enough. Take a class, if only see what this fuss about the socks is all about. Won't disappoint.

Best ever. VERY dry sense of humor - you have to pay close attention or you'll think he's serious when he's really making fun of you to amuse himself. Gives excellent feedback on papers and is especially good in tutorials. Also, awesome socks.

Always has coffee in hand and may I add that he wears awesome socks! Good class to take... a bit dry though and you need to pay attention, but essay topics are easy, fair marking, and if you also have him as a TA, you'll enjoy it so much more. Overall, good class. Final exams he hands out the questions, so final was pretty much a breeze.

Niall is awesome! Essay topics and required readings were good but a little on the easy side for people who are into the subject. Generated great class discussion and is a super nice, down to earth guy. He brought our tutorial breakfast one day as an apology for giving us back our graded papers late :)

contrary to popular opinion...i liked this guy! lectures got pretty boring at times, but i think first year courses are the hardest to teach, and his classical mythology course did a great job of introducing students to a lot major texts

I had a terrible time in this class. TOO hard for a 100level course. Some 4th years in the class said it was the hardest class they've ever taken. There were 10 textbooks and no time to read them all. Got the most TERRIBLE TA, he couldn't speak/spell and was an economics major, wth?! This prof was better than Gandesha though.

REALLY, REALLY helpful! He taught with Dr. Gandesha last semester but did a MUCH better job with his lectures - he made them engaging and interactive by talking to US. (Not murmuring to himself like the other prof did.) I was only upset because he didn't lecture as often. Good job, Dr. Duguid, keep up the good work!
Really good lectures that he endeavors to make interesting by using music and related art.

looking back, he was one of the best profs i've had so far. he made the material interesting with his personal insight and understanding. try to get him as your tutorial leader, it makes the class so much better. just having his lecture isn't the same thing

This course was excellent. All the readings were great. However, the course covers too many very broad topics each week. Steve's lectures were very informative, still. I would definately take anouther course with him.
He kinda makes engaging stuff seem boring, but maybe that's cause it's 8:30am. Wish he'd do more interaction with the students too. It's easier than remembering the Q and finding his office later.

Enjoyed this class. There is a lot to read though. We go through one text a week. The class is set up so that you have 2 hours of tutorial and 1 hour of lecture to encourage discussion. He knows what he is talking about and is perhaps, too sure about it.
Amazing prof, one of the best I've ever had.  A true pleasure.  I'd take anything taught by him in the future.
No Comments
Liked the class, liked him
Capable prof - watch out for the 101 final!
He does not know how to take
very nice man, good teacher. it's a shame the class itself is so boring.

Lots of reading, be prepared. Some books are completely boring, others a bit better. He gives good feedback though, I find the TA's may mark easier than him. So if you can get a tutorial with a TA over him, it may be a bit easier on your mark. Overall class was moderate.

I didn't think I would enjoy his class, as I took it literally as an intro to Humanties but I loved it. He's a great professor, knowledgable of the topics, and helpful plus understanding. I had him as a tutorial leader as well, and he was just as great a tutorial leader as he was in lecture.

Wayne was a great prof! Although he is a little bit "out there," he seemed to be very into what he was teaching and it made it very interesting. Everything was marked fairly easily (by all of the profs it seemed). Honestly I only read about half of every book and still got an A. Dedicated prof, LOTS of reading, easy marking, easy course.

He is a tough grader. Don't take hum 101 if you are looking for a gpa booster unless you enjoy reading books by Plato, Diderot or Saint Augustine. Which I personally found very boring. His lectures were confusing and his tutorials were even more confusing. Overall, he is a good person, not a professor.

Dr. Knights is a great professor. Amazing knowledge in his field, laid back personality, makes essay writing very accessible to the new university student, makes some great jokes, fair grader, very easy to talk to. The only fault with the course is that the material is sometimes quite ambiguous, making papers difficult to write.

-lectures are useless; just reads off his notes which are posted on canvas. does not offer much insight as to how he grades your paper. really seems very uninterested in what hes talking about. think sfu needs to get new humanities professors. this guys disinterest is honestly contagious. super boring class, wouldve been fun with someone else.

Wayne is pretty funny, but I don't really like the teaching style of the class. It was just him talking for 2 hours straight with no powerpoint slides and us taking notes. My TA was useless and tutorials usually just consisted of her rambling and going off topic. Overall, I think he could have picked more interesting books and better TA's.
Easiest and  most helpful teacher: you cannot get below a B if you show up (sometimes) and give him a reasonable paper. No research required!
Hilarious and always available for help.
He is so easy-going. I did almost nothing in the course and still got a B. The marking is fair.
really nice man. easy work. impossible to get less than a B. Just use sparknotes.

He is the best. Very nice and humorous, also extremely knowledgeable. His lectures were very insightful and intriguing. He will introduce you to some amazing literature that will affect your life. Do go to his lecture, you will learn a ton. Definitely take your HUM course with him. It's a shame if you are in SFU and never take his class.

Very laid back, pretty funny, nice guy. Accommodating as well, will help you with papers and he'll give you options if you want to contest a grade. A fairly easy marker imo. The texts are important texts from across all cultures and periods.
Overall, he was a great prof. Really enjoyed his class. He makes his lectures very clear and the tutorials were useful too.

Hum 101 was a great class, Dr. Crowe really took the time to meet and chat about papers and key concepts regarding assignments. He was a very fair professor and his course allowed for a great introduction to humanities.

This class seems pretty easy at the beginning. Although when it comes time to quizzes it is impossible to prepare for them or be ready for them. The general ideas are not tested but very specific details that seem irrelevant are tested. I would not recommend this course. It is definitely not a GPA booster. It is all about philosophy.

One of the worst profs I've ever had. Boring, inconsistent, and a terrible grader. Rubrics and comments constantly have one-word responses next to incomplete grades, with absolutely NO feedback or suggestions on what you can fix to improve your mark. Avoid classes with him if you value your sanity.

He is an amazing teacher, and really cares about his students. Gandesha values everyones differing opinions and thoughts, and often provokes insightful ideas. There is a lot of reading but it was his first time running this course. He very much is polisci so keep up to date with the news, but he is lovely so if you do the homework you will be fine.

He really knows what he's talking about, however, he seems to expect too much from his students. Over all it was a very interesting class, because he was able to relate the content very well to modern society, but there was way to much reading required.

VERY boring. Droned on and on about stuff unrelated to the class. 10 textbooks, two 10 page papers, no time to do all that! NOT a 100level course. GET A GOOD TA, I got a terrible one. I talked to Gandesha about issues with my TA and he disregarded it. Worst course I've ever taken.

This guy butchered HUM 101 for me big time! Not only are his lectures BORING, but he drones on and on in tutorial! Texts were interesting, but he didn't really do anything engaging to him. Not helpful at all.

At first I found his lecture style made me a bit sleepy, but then I woke up and realized he was REALLY interesting. Excellent prof,more than fair, show him you're interested and you'll do fine. Assignments were challenging, but he is a fair marker. Too many books to read, but at least they were all short.
Really nice. Lectures were sometimes irrelevant, but a great course. I enjoyed it.
Worst class ever... can't hear a word he's saying. wears super weird suits. need to read 4 books a week... 10-14paged essays... pointless.

heyyy now he wasnt that bad.  yes he did cancel lectures cuz his kids were sick, and a time or two more for who knows why...but he was a nice guy.  he sends out his notes via email too, so if you just read over those and add some original thoughts, you'll do just dandy on his exams.
Samir can be a bit of a flake (he's forgotten notes and cancelled classes on short notice), but the things he teaches are really interesting and class discussions are fantastic.
No Comments

Who the hell assigns 9 textbooks for a 13 week 100 level class? Obviously this prof is way over himself and thinks that his students have no other classes. I'm sorry, but my life is not going to focus around you and your incompetent teaching abilities.

Where on earth did this guy come from? Absolutely boring, uninteresting, disengaging, and does not deserve the privelage of teaching this course. Waaay too many readings for what this course is. This prof needs some serious help.
Horrible, borrrrring, etc

While he said my writing was quite good, he still gave me a poor mark on one essy.  That aside, he taught in a very engaging manner (...what he taught was pure crap), always made himself available, funny (not as funny as he thinks he is), and his exam is exactly as he described it.  The only bad thing, incomprehensible marking scheme.
No Comments

He's hot, and smart and funny, but his teaching style is not very good. He wasn't very clear, especially with the essays and I'm pretty sure he screwed a bunch of people over on the final exam. His marking/grading didn't make any sense to me.

Neven was one of the most interesting profs I have had so far in my post-secondary career. He is probably one of the few that would encourage students to go find him for help on essays, assignments and readings. Overall, his lectures were informative and his assignments did help the class improve. He is an awesome prof =)

Neven was incredible!! I couldn't believe how smart, funny and helpful he was.  He's very clear with what he expects...so as long as you follow his guidelines you'll do great in the class.  I learned a ton and would highly recommend his class.
good teacher overall

Neven is an awsome prof.  He is always willing to help and he is very very funny.   He's very helpful, and because of his help my writing improved greatly.  His lectures are very interesting.  I would recommend that anyone who has a chance to take Neven's class should.  Again very interesting class because of the prof!!

The course content was so interesting,and the proffesor gave a really interesting history behind all texts and highlighted important themes.He was very useful, and ALWAYS available to help students! Lectures were interesting, comical, clear, informative and consistent. He was by far my favorite prof. We studied voltaire,more,plato,smith and kafka!!
Neven made the subject shine! He was informative, insightful, and always willing to help. The classes were a lot of fun, owing much to his engaging character.
Humurous, youthful, intellectual and reasonable.

Awesome teacher! incredibly knowledgable about the subject and he actually makes learning this stuff really interesting.Very funny teacher too so it makes the class a blast. Devoted to his students, and always available for help. He won't do it for you but he explains clearly what you need to do, which is the best way to help students!!
Truly an amazing prof. She is very knowledgeable and enthusiastic about humanities! It was a pleasure to learn from her.
I love Chris.  She is such a wonderful professor and human being.  You'd have to be incredibly lazy or one-dimensional not to like her/her courses.

I have found Dr. Jones to be one of the most engaging professors at SFU. She really takes an interest in her students' well being, and understands that her assigments are not the only assignments a student gets.
One of the best Profs I've ever had. Nice, helpful, and passionate. Even talking with her would make you feel better. Highly recommended Prof for this course!!!

Excellent prof, small intimate classes, like maybe 150 people. Great tutorials lots of discussion shes SO open mided got A's on all my essays. Read the books, they're interesting and not difficult to understand. Shes a one in a million prof, really cares and has a GREAT TA Michael!
She is one the best profs I've ever had. Very well-organized, friendly, helpful, and fair marker.

One of the best profs I've ever had!  Well-organized, friendly, open-minded and helpful.  Hum. 101 is more philosophical and theoretical (requiring lots of reading) so here's a warning to those who doesn't like reading/or philosophy, otherwise, she's definitely a great prof to have!  :)
LOVE HER!  She is so wonderful, intelligent and caring; I was excited to go to class every week.

Chris is a great teacher. I think she does her best with her upper division classes though. I find it difficult to agree with comments like: "this course had too many things to read or do" because one must remember that Hum 101W is a Writing intensive course, hence the W. You chose it so don't complain about it. Overall, great prof!
Dr. Jones is a good prof, very helpful, wants the best for her students... even though I got a D. Workload is quite a bit also.
Awesome!~
chris will continue to inspire many
quite boring class..but she tries her best.

I LOVE HER! If you go see her in her office hours she'll be glad o help you.I was writing an essay and I went to her about my thesis, She told me mine wasn't very good and we rewrote it together. Totaly helped me so much.
Chris is one of the best teachers you can get at SFU. If you like reading and enjoy super interesting conversations during class, you must take one of her classes.
I had to try not to fall asleep many times
Chris herself is great but I found the class material got too complex considering it is  a 1st year course
I loved this course! It was a lot of work but it was also worth it - I learned SO much. I think everyone should have to take this course in order to be an intelligent informed citizen.

I didn't feel that this course was extremely difficult as some people say, however, you have to be interested in the course work because there are some really tricky concepts to know.  chris on the other hand is a wonderful, helpful, and an easily accessible prof who made my first semester as a university student a bit easier.

Would not recommend this course if you do not do well in English. Prof talks about the author and gives background info about the text but doesn't talk about/explain the text itself. TA's are good. If you know how to write a good essay and understand what you are reading, go for it

Good proff.  Yeah, you guys are right, definitely not a first year...no we mean high school class.  That's university.  Most proffs will give you as many books but make you read full texts, not a few chapters.  At least that's what you get with any descent prof in the humanities.

Chris is a nice, intelligent prof but the course didn't work well. 1 hour lectures did not give enough time to properly cover reading material.  Would have been better with 2hr. lectures and half as many readings.  Lectures at 8:30am probably didnt help either.  Notes for lectures posted online were not helpful

do not take this class unless u feel u can handle the work load. also as the people below have mentioned. this is not a first year class although it is listed as a 100 level course. be advised you will be reading and writing heavily. and make sure to tank those wonderful ta's at the end of semester.
NOT a first year class. A lot of reading and difficult concepts. This class made my brain hurt. Chris is nice and clear, but the class is really tough.

pretty mellow proff... cool accent, hard to understand her though. definetly not first year class. the work load is major. the book list is major and hard to understand. if it weren't for the TA's i would no diddly
This class is definetly not for a first year student. Shes okay but i think she has a fake accent... SHE SAYS UMANS INSTEAD OF HUMANS
I didn't have him for my tutorials, but from what I read here he sounds like a hard marker. He was a good lecturer, very friendly and obviously interested in the material.  Overall a nice guy.
Tutorials are mandatory, though you'll have to mention something about readings and what you found interesting. Lectures aren't too bad, just not interesting.

This prof is completely incomprehensible. He talks very fast yet he has no idea what he is really talking about. His lectures are very unorganized, and he may like his subject but he has no idea how to teach it. The textbook was very expensive, yet it was not thorough enough for a proper essay.

His instructions are unclear. His class is useless to go to. His expectations are way to high for his short essays. One of my least favorite profs.. try to avoid his tutorial classes or else you'll be forced to find and talk about something interesting every week.
Textbook was sooo boring and we had to read THE WHOLE THING. Expectations are unclear and unreasonable.

She's okay as a professer, but the overall course is too much. There's an in-class essay question every week at the beginning of the lecture (marks). Although it is a writing intensive course, discussions in class seem to go by quick, leaving everything else as independent study. She's quite old so you have to get use to her style of teaching.
